16749.name: ICONS SQUEEZE MACHINE
16749.description:
A Figma plugin that allows you to merge multiple `SVG` paths into a single one for selected icons and then save them as a `JSON` file.


üì∫ Youtube demo

ü§ñ Icons to test

üëæ GitHub Page


--


What is the plugin for


In case if you use icons in a project as an `Icon` component, important to store all assets in one place and as compact as possible. In this case it better to load only one `path d` instead of store multiple paths for one SVG icon.


If you not familiar with the method check this article


So the plugin cuts the chain ‚õìÔ∏è: export icons ‚Üí load to icomoon.io ‚Üí export and save font ‚Üí extract `JSON` ‚Üí clean it. üèÅ


With the plugin the chain should be ‚õìÔ∏è: export icons. üèÅ


--


How to use


  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Select your icons set. Important ‚Äî icons should be selected, not the only one frame where they are. In this case the plugin will try to merge all icons into one within this frame.
  3. Click on the `Preview` button.
  4. Check that all icons are displayed as they should.
  5. Click on the `Download JSON` button.


Plugin will generate `ZIP` folder with `JSON` file and `HTML` file that will preview all icons from the saved `JSON`.


--


How it works


The full `SVG` code for an icon will be:

<svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">

<path d="M8 15C8.55228 15 9 14.5523 9 14C9 13.4477 8.55228 13 8 13C7.44772 13 7 13.4477 7 14C7 14.5523 7.44772 15 8 15Z" fill="#17191C"/>

<path d="M12 15C12.5523 15 13 14.5523 13 14C13 13.4477 12.5523 13 12 13C11.4477 13 11 13.4477 11 14C11 14.5523 11.4477 15 12 15Z" fill="#17191C"/>

<path d="M17 14C17 14.5523 16.5523 15 16 15C15.4477 15 15 14.5523 15 14C15 13.4477 15.4477 13 16 13C16.5523 13 17 13.4477 17 14Z" fill="#17191C"/>

<rect x="7" y="1" width="2" height="2" fill="#17191C"/>

<rect x="15" y="1" width="2" height="2" fill="#17191C"/>

<path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M2 7C2 4.79086 3.79086 3 6 3H7V5H9V3H15V5H17V3H18C20.2091 3 22 4.79086 22 7V17C22 19.2091 20.2091 21 18 21H6C3.79086 21 2 19.2091 2 17V7ZM4 9V17C4 18.1046 4.89543 19 6 19H18C19.1046 19 20 18.1046 20 17V9H4Z" fill="#17191C"/>

</svg>


The shortened code generated by the plugin will be:

"M8 15C8.55228 15 9 14.5523 9 14C9 13.4477 8.55228 13 8 13C7.44772 13 7 13.4477 7 14C7 14.5523 7.44772 15 8 15Z M12 15C12.5523 15 13 14.5523 13 14C13 13.4477 12.5523 13 12 13C11.4477 13 11 13.4477 11 14C11 14.5523 11.4477 15 12 15Z M16 15C16.5523 15 17 14.5523 17 14C17 13.4477 16.5523 13 16 13C15.4477 13 15 13.4477 15 14C15 14.5523 15.4477 15 16 15Z M9 1H7V3H6C3.79086 3 2 4.79086 2 7V17C2 19.2091 3.79086 21 6 21H18C20.2091 21 22 19.2091 22 17V7C22 4.79086 20.2091 3 18 3H17V1H15V3H9V1ZM9 3V5H7V3H9ZM4 17V9H20V17C20 18.1046 19.1046 19 18 19H6C4.89543 19 4 18.1046 4 17Z M15 3V5H17V3H15Z"


--


Possible issues


  • Failed union Boolean operation. Icon elements were merged incorrectly. Solution ‚Äî fix vector shapes manually ‚Äî flatten shapes and outline curves. Sometimes the layers order could be an issue.
  • You selected a frame with icons but not icons. Please, note that you need to select icons, not the parent frame.


--


Plugin doesn't run any custom code to outline, flatten and union icons, it uses only figma API methods

182424.name: JSON to Figma
182424.description:
An easy way to use real data in Figma.

The plugin can parse local or JSON files from a URL link. You can populate any layers with text or images.


üí° Features:

  1. Load local files and fetch from URL
  2. Fetch images
  3. Supported formats JPG, PNG, WEBP, SVG, GIF
  4. Parsing JSON files with any amount of nested levels
  5. Flexible keys selection
  6. Populate in random order
  7. Select any ranges from JSON file
  8. Ability to skip layers
  9. Remember user settings and JSON using clientStorage
  10. Custom URL for your own proxy


üìö Documentation:

https://pavellaptev.notion.site/JSON-to-Figma-e4f79e250b54413ba5797c1d4a806070


üé• Video Tutorial:

https://youtube.com/watch?v=OO2yeeNuj7A&si=EnSIkaIECMiOmarE


ü§ô Feedback:

Please if you have any troubles with the plugin or ideas how I could improve the plugin.

networkAccess.reasoning: We need to access the internet to fetch the JSON file from the URL or load images and use different proxy servers.

51871.name: Variants Randomizer
51871.description:
Variants Randomizer ‚Äî a powerful tool designed to simplify the process of adding variation to your designs.


With just a few clicks, you can randomize multiple variants, including boolean and nested props, and even restrict duplicates. Choose the properties you want to use and watch as the plugin instantly generates new variations.


üöÄ Features

  • Randomise multiple variants
  • Supports `boolean` props
  • Supports `nested` props
  • Restrict duplicates
  • Choose which properties you want to use


üìÖ Trial period ‚Äî 5 days


üé• Loom video

üìô Guide file

21021.name: SVG to Image
21021.description:
Use SVG as raster images in Figma. A simple solution for SVG import.


Scale modes:


You can also scale your image when you import it, as you usually do when you export images in Figma ‚Äî by scale (@2x, @3x, etc.) by width or height. All these scale modes have restrictions for the maximum value.


Check the project on Github


Enjoy!

15748.name: Auto Layout Styles
15748.description:
The plugin brings an experience of Figma styles to the auto-layout feature. You can make separate configurations of auto-layouts, save and load them, lock or change at any time.


üì∫ Demo Video on YouTube


ü§î When do I need it?

  • If you use the same spacers between certain components or elements.
  • If you have a team and want it to use and apply layouts rules in a comfortable way.
  • If you have multiple projects with different spacer setting and want to keep all in consistency.


üßû‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è How it works

The plugin works in the same way as sharable styles in Figma. But the plugin stores these styles as a JSON file.


You can add so many layouts as you want and save them separately as a layouts configuration.


ü§ñ How to use

Before you will start to apply layouts, you need to select two or more elements. Than click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button and plugin will automatically apply auto-layout styles from the plugin's layout card.


üíæ  Autosave feature

The plugin uses Figma's plugin storage - so even if you closed the plugin without saving, all your changes will be there the next time you launch the plugin again.


ü™¢ Hook names

Hook names is a string that will be applied as an auto-layout layer name.


This is important to have distinguish and unique names for each layout, because only with this condition the plugin will be able successfully update multiple layouts automatically.


üí£ Update all layouts at once by hook names

If you used the plugin before and adjusted all layouts, each type of layout will have a specific name.


Clicking on the ‚ÄúUpdate all by hooks‚Äù button the plugin will go through all layouts on the page and apply layouts styles from you configuration.


üîí Lock composition

Each layout can be locked if you want to make your work with the plugin more safely.


üîó Links

Project on GitHub

Figma project

My website

Support the plugin
15748.release_notes:
ü¶ä Better changes autosave
üí¨ Messages text updated

15858.name: Nicolas Cage Image Replacer
15858.description:
Nicolas Cage Image Replacer is an easy way to bring one of the most meme-actors into your Figma file. It's also could be a fun way to prank colleagues üòÉ


üçΩ How to use

Run the plugin. Click on the "Cage on the page!" button ‚Äî the plugin will take all frames or shapes with the image fill and add an additional Nicolas Cage image on the top.


‚öôÔ∏è How it works

  • The plugin don't replace the existing image, but add an additional image fill to the layer on the top.
  • You can remove all Cage images by just one button.
  • You can remove all Cage images even if you closed the plugin. All images with hash IDs will be associated with the plugin until you delete them. Hash IDs will be created for each page where you run the plugin.


üì∫ Youtube Demo

üïπ GitHub Repo

26081.name: Timers
26081.description:
The plugin allows setting up multiple timers as a single flow.


- Use and create your own templates

- save and load timers configurations as a JSON file

- minimized version supported

- timers mute and reordering

- autosaving to storage after you close the plugin.

102.name: Layer Names Transfom
102.description:
This plugin will help you to quickly transform the names of your layers. This plugin could be helpful in a case when you need to export many icons or images but you need to have all layer names in lower or upper case. Also, this plugin will help you to replace spaces and add extra symbols to the names of your layers.

Features:
- Convert names to lower or upper case.
- Join words with a symbol
- Replace symbols in names
- Add symbols
- Remove symbol

56215.name: GPTify ‚ú¶ GPT sandbox

61788.name: StilTausch ‚ú∑ Swap styles with variables
61788.description:
StilTausch is a Figma plugin that allows you to swap styles with variables.


‚ö†Ô∏è Restrictions

1. This plugin works only with team libraries, which means you need to publish your library before you can swap styles.

2. The plugin swaps only color styles.

3. Doesn't swap styles on INSTANCE components.


Links

  • Docs and the repo üìñ
  • Preview of how it works üé•


Features

  • Run the plugin for the current page or entire file
  • Swap all styles automatically
  • Swap manually by names


Feedback

If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to leave a comment here or create an issue on GitHub.
61788.release_notes: - Alphabetic sorting for styles in the list added

177622.name: TokensBr√ºcke
177622.description:
TokensBr√ºcke is a Figma plugin that simplifies the process of converting Figma variables into design-tokens JSON. The plugin generates JSON files compatible with the latest Design Tokens specification.


üöÄ Features:

  1. Color Modes: Choose from different color modes like HEX, RGBA, HSLA, and more for flexible color representation.
  2. Styles Support: Include typography, grids, shadows, and blur effects into the design tokens JSON, enhancing design element organization.
  3. Server Integration: Connect to JSONBin, GitHub, GitLab or a custom server to directly push the generated JSON for easy distribution.
  4. Aliases Handling: Automatically convert aliases into the appropriate string format.
  5. Output preview: check the output before export


üìö Documentation

  1. Full documentation documentation on Github
  2. Style dictionary utils


üì£ Feedback

If you have any issues or ideas you can leave a comment, write me to pavellaptev.figma@gmail.com or create an issue on Github.

networkAccess.reasoning: There is a push method that uses a custom URL. This URL can be any

177622.release_notes: fix: hardcoded style colors into variables
177622.tagline: Convert Figma Variables to Design Tokens
